quest.name: Flight of the Charybdis
journal:
î‚¾ Quest Sync
The frazzled researcher seeks help in chasing down a missing creature.
objectives: Capture the charybdis at Peripeteia Krystalline.
Deliver the captured charybdis to the frazzled researcher.

dialogue.name: HURRYOBSERVER04311
dialogue.text: You there! Please, it is most urgent. A colleague of mine in Philomythes Notos has just sent word of a most disturbing nature.

dialogue.name: HURRYOBSERVER04311
dialogue.text: A blue charybdis was practicing its flying, but became separated from its fellows. From what I gathered, based on my friend's manic message, it was last seen taking wing to Peripeteia Krystalline.

dialogue.name: HURRYOBSERVER04311
dialogue.text: We are all of us searching far and wide, but could you look in the direction of Peripeteia Krystalline? Your help will not go unrewarded, I can assure you of that.

dialogue.name: HURRYOBSERVER04311
dialogue.text: Oh, thank you! Between us, we ought to be able to locate this lost creature.

dialogue.name: HURRYOBSERVER04311
dialogue.text: You should know that charybdises have a penchant for heights, so I will scan the skies around here. I leave the upper floors of Peripeteia Krystalline to you.

dialogue.name: HURRYOBSERVER04311
dialogue.text: If you do happen to find the creature I spoke of, use this aetheric rope to bind it. Ah, not to worry: the bindings cause no injury or pain. Good luck, and I shall see you soon.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: There is no sign of the charybdis.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The charybdis is nowhere to be seen...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Now that you've captured the injured charybdis, return to Poieten Oikos and deliver your winged captive to the frazzled researcher.

dialogue.name: HURRYOBSERVER04311
dialogue.text: I saw that you were on your way back, and hastened to return as well. So, what news? Have you found that blue charybdis?

dialogue.name: HURRYOBSERVER04311
dialogue.text: Oh, a great relief indeed! It's rather impressive it hasn't suffered any truly grievous injuries...and more impressive still that it was able to fly as far as Peripeteia Krystalline.

dialogue.name: HURRYOBSERVER04311
dialogue.text: It had only begun to practice the art of flight recently, as I understand it. Who would have thought it could cross such a distance with wings still so inexperienced? No doubt credit for this ought go to Emet-Selch and his helpful instruction.

dialogue.name: HURRYOBSERVER04311
dialogue.text: Well, I for one cannot wait to see the charybdis take to the skies from its perch.

dialogue.name: HURRYOBSERVER04311
dialogue.text: At any rate, I will see this creature returned to Anagnorisis at once. Though it isn't much, considering the services you've rendered, I hope it's not too lowly a prize for you.
